questions.question: Q1. The task on our hand is to determine whether a graph contains cycle or not. Select the method you can use

explanations.a: BFS can be used to find the cycle in a directed graph but in case of undirected graph we need to do topological sorting first.
explanations.b: DFS keeps the record of visited node and also a stack.

questions.question: Q2. Allan was using DFS on a tree, he used the same code on a graph but the results were not correct. What could be the reason?

answers.a: DFS can only be used on trees
answers.b: DFS can be used on graphs but we need to keep track of visited nodes
answers.c: Need to use a stack in DFS

explanations.b: Graph can contain cycles, so we need to keep track of visited nodes.
explanations.c: DFS in tree uses stack implicitly (recursion call), but in graph we need to use it explicitly. Thus absence of stack is not the reason for incorrect results.

questions.question: Q3. What will be the order of traversal of nodes in DFS for the following graph starting from node 2? (Assume that the nodes are traversed in numerical order.)

explanations.c: The dfs will start from node go to 0 and from 0 to 4 and so on.

questions.question: Q4. What will be the order of traversal of nodes in BFS for the following graph starting from node 5? (Assume that the nodes are traversed in numerical order.)

explanations.a: This is the order of traversal if DFS is used. BFS will give 50134267.
explanations.b: THe bfs uses queue so from 5 it will add 0,1,3 and 4 into the queue and then it will pop 0 and add 2 into the queue and so on.
